envDistribution 0.0.0.9000

Add spatial attribute/s

Source: R/add_spt_att.R
add_spt_att.Rd

Adds attributes from a spatial layer to a data frame, e.g. add indigenous or vagrant status from a distribution layer to a data frame of taxa occurrences.

add_spt_att(
  df,
  lyr,
  att_cols,
  renames = NULL,
  df_x = "long",
  df_y = "lat",
  df_crs = 4326,
  use_crs = NULL,
  buffer_km = 0
)

Arguments

df

Data frame containing coordinate columns.

lyr

sf object with polygons containing the attributes to be added to df.

att_cols

Character vector of attribute columns from lyr to add to df.

renames

Named character vector of attribute columns to rename for the output, e.g. c("spatial_ind" = "ind", "spatial_ind" = "isIndigenous").

df_x, df_y

Character. Name of the columns in df that have the x and y coordinates.

df_crs

Integer. Coordinate reference system that the coordinates in df correspond to (epsg code).

use_crs

Integer. Coordinate reference system (epsg code) to use as the standard for all objects in spatial joins. Using a projected coordinate system removes the sf warning around assuming coordinates are planar if they're not, and can sometimes help with spherical geometry issues. If NULL, the crs of the distribution will be used as the standard (i.e. the df coords and lyr will be converted to this crs before joining).

buffer_km

Integer. Distance in kilometres used to buffer the lyr and attribute records in that radius. Use 0 for no buffer.

Value

Data frame equivalent to df with specified attributes from lyr.

Contents

Developed by Joel Allan, Nigel Willoughby.
